pages.text: I seem to have stumbled upon wood with higher magical potency than the average tree. I also noticed trees with arcane magic have unique properties, serving atypical functions or yielding quite unusual... fruits. I may be able to use this wood for more complex magic.
Due to the unique properties of some of these trees, I will record my findings on each tree here.

pages.title: Bloodwood Tree
pages.text: A blood-soaked tree growing atop soul sand.

A bloodthirsty tree!$(br)It was only hapstance that I discovered this tree, as it doesn't seem to grow in the wild. Only through experimenting with combining saplings with souls was I able to create a sapling.$(br)Furthermore, they have an unquinchable thirst for blood and soul, growing exponentially so long as they are fed.

pages.title: Ethereal Tree
pages.text: A blood-soaked tree growing atop soul sand.
(Placeholder).

pages.title: Golden Oak
pages.text: A golden oak sits atop a floating Aether island.

These trees, while not difficult to find, are uncommon variants of Skyroot trees in the Aether. Their shimmering leaves and gold-infused wood are a treasure to be desired. The amber from these trees seem to be gold-infused, giving it unique properties. Occassionally, I have spotted large clusters of these trees. I wonder what this signifies.

pages.title: Hellbark Tree
pages.text: A stout little tree taking on the heat.
These tiny little trees are almost mistaken for bushes. Being endemic to the Nether has allowed these tiny trees to completely resist fire, making it a nice fireproof material to work with.

pages.title: Ironwood
pages.text: A mighty iron-wrought tree with a hefty trunk.

These mighty trees get their coloration and toughness from ferous deposits in the soil.$(br2)The berries these trees produce are also incredibly tough, but still edible.$(br2)Eating one doesn't have desireable effects, but may have useful alchemical purposes.

pages.title: Magic Tree
pages.text: Magical blue sparkles falls of a shimmering tree.
These magical trees seems to draw upon the surrounding leylines, saturating the wood with magick.$(br2)This seems to give the wood some unique magical properties...

pages.title: Rainbow Oak
pages.text: Colorful rainbow leaves shift in tones and color.
This colorful tree is pretty to look at!$(br2)The leaves change colors on their own, shifting through the entire rainbow.$(br2)Otherwise, its wood is that of Twilight Oak.

pages.title: Robust Twilight Oak
pages.text: An incredibly tall tree touching the sky.

This majestic tree is capable of growing to incredible heights.$(br2)It seems to attract singing cicadas and bright fireflies.$(br2)Most interestingly, the leaves sometimes contain spider nests guarding treasure...

pages.title: Sacred Oak
pages.text: A gigantic oak blotting out the sky.

Such large trees seem impossible. Then again, obtaining a sapling seemed like a myth in of itself.$(br2)While their properties are not particularly unique, I suspect some form of magick allows for this tree's enormous size.

pages.title: Umbran Tree
pages.text: A dark ominous tree in a thick fog.

Thriving in an eerie, umbral environment, these trees are as mysterious and odd as the biome they grow in.$(br2)Dark mysterious forces are strong in Umbral biomes, and this darkness has seeped into these trees.

pages.title: Crystal Tree
pages.text: A pastel crystalline tree sitting atop a floating rock.
These lone trees sit atop floating islands in the Aether, making them a bit of a challenge to reach.$(br2)It's certainly worth the effort, as they bear a fruit capable of curing ailments.

pages.title: Wyrmwood
pages.text: An enormous tree, thriving in an otherwise desolate land.
In what was thought to be an empty, desolate land thrives the Wyrmwood. It's unknown where they get their nutrients to grow. Perhaps the infestation I found inside has something to do with it.
